activity-description.narrative: Cambodia

description.narrative: 1. National ME Framework is approved and functional including gender disaggregated and poverty indicators 2. Number of ministries with institutional arrangement to manage their Climate Change Action Plan (CCAP) and contribute to Climate Change Technical Team (CCTT) activities 3. Number of ministries that demonstrate capacity to implement at least 50% actions in their CCAPs and report on CCAP progress in line with national standards (incl. gender analysis) 4. Legal mandates for the National Climate Change Committee (NCCC), CCTT and NCCC secretariat strengthened

comment.narrative: Baseline 2013 1. A draft ME Framework is under discussion 2. 2 3. 0 4. Institutional and legal review is on-going
1. National level indicators approved and baselines established 2. 3 3. 0 4. New royal decree and sub decree drafted

1. Indicators and baselines are ready to be launched. 2. 3 (Ministry of Agriculture Forestry and Fisheries, Ministry of Women's Affairs and Ministry of Rural Development have established working groups in charge of climate change issues, under senior leadership). 3. 0 4. Royal Decree and Sub-Decree on the National Council for Sustainable Development and its General Secretariat adopted in May 2015.

1. Climate Change ME framework contributes to NSDP mid-term review
2. 5 ministries with institutional arrangement to manage their Climate Change Action Plan (CCAP) and contribute to Climate Change Technical Team (CCTT) activities
3.
4. New royal decree and sub decree adopted

capital of a political entity

activity-description.narrative: The project intend to contribute to nation wide impact.

description.narrative: independent political entity

activity-description.narrative: The project aim to strengthen the capacity of the Disability Action Council to be able to advocate for disability inclusiveness in public policies and regulations therefore enable disable people across the country to benefit from equal rights and treatment.

description.narrative: Human rights affairs
This output supports Disabled Peoples Organisations to raise the voice and protect the rights of people with disabilities
capital of a political entity

activity-description.narrative: The project intends to contribute to nation wide impact even though most coordination activities are in Phnom Penh.

description.narrative: independent political entity

activity-description.narrative: The project aims to strengthen capacities of Disabled People Organizations be able to channel their voices to influence policies and regulations concerning the rights of people with disabilities nationwide.

description.narrative: Human rights affairs

1. No. of advocacy strategies developed, based on strong evidence and implemented to influence government ministry and institution to develop disability inclusive policies 2. No. of persons with diverse disabilities, including women have increased participation in democratic processes 3. No. of advocacy strategies developed implemented to influence key ministries to improve the implementation of disability law and UNCRPD on access to information, public accessibility, and access to employment 4. Increased awareness about the United Nations Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities (UNCRPD) demonstrated by the general public 5. Increased awareness on disability rights issues among targeted groups (general public, NGOs, government ministries, persons with disabilities, private sector, and Disabled People Organizations (DPOs)) 6. Increased awareness about UNCRPD among DPOs, key relevant ministries, disability NGOs and CSOs

comment.narrative: There is no data available for baseline.

1. 5 (1-One advocacy strategy developed for ministry of information to ensure disability is included into their policies and framework; 2-One advocacy strategy for National Election Committee developed; 3-Two disability advocacy statements developed and submitted to government for actions disability type and classification policy, pension scheme for persons with disabilities; 4-One advocacy strategy for National Committee for Disaster Management developed) 2. 2,000 (45% are women with disabilities) persons with diverse disabilities participated in the democratic process (commune investment process) 60% of members (136,000) are able to join the community activity and have rights/voices to make decision. 3. 5 (1-One advocacy strategy on information policy developed; 2- One advocacy strategy on election policy developed; 3- One advocacy strategy on disaster risk management developed; 4- 3 statements on improving the national disability and UNCRPD implementation type and level of disability classification policy, pension scheme for persons with disabilities, job employment at private sector). 4. About 100,000 people will receive awareness on UNCRPD through IEC materials, radio programme and campaigns/forums. 5. 136, 000 received awareness on disability rights and those 40% are able to actively participate in awareness campaigns/forums. 6. 30% increase awareness about UNCRPD among DPOs, key relevant ministries, disability NGOs and CSOs.

1. 7 (One advocacy strategy for MoInf.; One advocacy strategy for NEC; Four advocacy statements submitted to gov't for pension disability classification data and one advocacy strategy for National Committee for Disaster Management) 2. 1700 (45% are women with disabilities) persons with diverse disabilities participated in the democratic process (commune investment plan and 450 persons with disabilities received ID poor card) and about 80% of members with disabilities were able to involve in community activity and DPOs activity plan process. 3. 7 advocacy strategies (MoInf, NEC, Disaster Risk Management and four statements on improving the national disability and uncrpd implementation ) 4. 124,694 including 24,694 persons with disabilities received awareness on UNCRPD through video/radio talk show and disability awareness events. 5. 124,694 including 24,694 persons with disabilities received awareness on disability rights and 18% were able to actively participate in awareness campaigns/forums. 6. 20% of DPOs, key relevant ministries and disability NGOs and CSOs increased knowledge through the active involvement of the UNCRPD reporting process

1. Disability inclusive policy implemented by NEC to ensure persons with disabilities enable to vote. 2. Voting registration identified the types of persons with disabilities for those who have registered. 3. Women with disabilities at leadership level increased to match the 50/50 gender policy within DPOs 5. Shadow report of UNCRPD drafted 6. CDPO membership database disaggregated by type location of entity

Enhanced Integrated Framework for Trade related Technical Assistance to LDC's Trust Fund manager
Enhanced Integrated Framework for Trade related Technical Assistance to LDC's Trust Fund manager

description.narrative: 1. Updated value chain study finalized 2. Association (s) of cassava exporters, processors and producers formulated to engage in policy dialogue, to find markets and to disseminate agricultural techniques for their members

comment.narrative: Baseline 2013 1. The latest value Chain study was produced in 2007 by Trade Promotion Department, Ministry of Commerce 2. There is no association in cassava
1. Updated Value Chain Study completed 2. Association is formed for the target beneficiaries of the project
1. The first draft of the cassava value chain study produced 2. 8 associations established in Tbong Khmom, Pailin, and Battambang provinces

1. Target exporters/processors are equipped with knowledge on export procedure and other export requirement of the three identified markets 2. Plan to strengthen capacity of Cambodia cassava exporters/processors produced and linked to the relevant entity to ensure sustainability/expansion 3. Connection with at least one selected market established 4. Knowledge on environmental impact of cassava processing in Cambodia and its proposed mitigation plan generated and disseminate to relevant stakeholders

1. 1st stage of capacity development plan for the target exporters/processors implemented focusing on orientation to understanding the export market, its requirement, and the key required rule and regulation. Expert to support market access is on board. The market access plan is expected in Q1 2017. 2. Capacity assessment for the cassava associations developed and the relevant capacity development plan produced. the finding from the assessment is used by the Ministry of Commerce to further support the established associations. 4. Draft of Environmental Impact Assessment on cassava processing produced. the draft is expected to be further consulted with stakeholder before its finalization in Q1 2017.
